meta.title: COVID-19 Updates to Parents - Greeneview Local School District

link.title: Greeneview Elementary School - News

form.name: aspnetForm

span.p: We encourage you to monitor the official website put out by the Ohio for your information. COVID-19 HOMEPAGE
They have a great site for families during this school shutdown. https://coronavirus.ohio.gov/wps/portal/gov/covid-19/home/Family-Activities/Resources-for-Parents-and-Families

Ohio Department of Education has published a list of resources for parents as they work with their children at home. These social-emotional resources and suggestions are sometimes more important than the continued instruction for our children. Please check out their suggestions and links to further resources. Supporting our Children's Well-being

div.a: Brain POP Video for Children on COVID-19

ul.li:
Google Survey: Food Needs During Closure
Food Bags are available between March 15th-30th for pick-up upon request from feedback@greeneview.org
School Breakfast and Lunch will be available for pickup from Greeneview High School beginning March 30th
Monday Pick-up from 11:30-1:30:
Meals will be for Monday and Tuesday
Wednesday Pick-up from 11:30-1:30
Meals will be for Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday

Jamestown food pantry and community meal information
The Community Food Pantry is open on Thursdays. Please call 937-675-3581 to make a Pantry appointment.
At this time the mobile food truck will not be available. They are working to get a waiver for the truck to still make deliveries. We will share information when it is available.
The Dayton FoodBank has recommended that the local food pantries do not take private donations at this time. “Effective this week we stopped taking public donations. We will continue working with 60+ local merchants, the Governor’s Office, Feeding America and other entities to source food, for as long as it takes, until we navigate through this new guidelines.”
The monthly Jamestown Free Community Meal will operate as a drive-through/pick up meal site on Wednesday, March 25th 6:00PM. Please contact the Food Pantry number for details.

One assignment has been made for students during the week of March 16th in each class.
This will serve as a trial week for students and teachers. Please communicate with your teacher if you are having issues accessing or completing your assignments.
Staff Email Addresses can be Found by Clicking Here
NO ASSIGNMENTS will be assigned the week of MARCH 23rd due to Spring Break
2 to 3 assignments will be assigned the week of March 30th

p.strong: Doors open every Monday from 8am-2pm for computer repairs (district devices only)

span.p: Greeneview Local School is currently working with vendors to incorporate more mobile hotspots rentals for students without home internet access capabilities.

div.div:
This is a secure Staff Intranet content page and cannot be viewed by the public. Please contact your Technology Director to gain access to the Staff Intranet area in order to view this page.
Thank you,
